<answer>
{
"action_description": "Type the properties of a torus into the document.",
"action_type": "Write",
"action_target": "Document input area (blank page, cursor active)",
"value": "A torus is a surface of revolution generated by revolving a circle in three-dimensional space about an axis coplanar with the circle. It has the shape of a ring or doughnut. The properties of a torus include:\n\n1. It has two sides: the outer and inner surfaces.\n2. It has one hole (a single topological hole).\n3. Its cross-section is a circle.\n4. The surface area is 4π²Rr, where R is the distance from the center of the tube to the center of the torus, and r is the radius of the tube.\n5. The volume is 2π²Rr².\n6. It is a 3D shape with genus 1 (one handle).\n7. It can be embedded in 3D space but not in 2D without self-intersection."
}
</answer>
pred_input_text:
A torus is a surface of revolution generated by revolving a circle in three-dimensional space about an axis coplanar with the circle. It has the shape of a ring or doughnut. The properties of a torus include:

1. It has two sides: the outer and inner surfaces.
2. It has one hole (a single topological hole).
3. Its cross-section is a circle.
4. The surface area is 4π²Rr, where R is the distance from the center of the tube to the center of the torus, and r is the radius of the tube.
5. The volume is 2π²Rr².
6. It is a 3D shape with genus 1 (one handle).
7. It can be embedded in 3D space but not in 2D without self-intersection.

pred_action_target: Document input area (blank page, cursor active)
